class_description: The example below shows how to encode an instance of a simple GroceryProduct type from a JSON object. The type adopts Codable so that it's encodable as JSON using a JSONEncoder instance.

Methods.method_description: Creates a new, reusable JSON encoder with the default formatting settings and encoding strategies.

params.param_description: The value to encode as JSON.

Methods.method_description: Returns a JSON-encoded representation of the value you supply.
Methods.method_declar: func encode<T>(_ value: T) throws -> Data where T : Encodable

Vars.var_description: A value that determines the readability, size, and element order of the encoded JSON object.
A value that determines how a type's coding keys are encoded as JSON keys.
A dictionary you use to customize the encoding process by providing contextual information.
The strategy used when encoding dates as part of a JSON object.
The strategy that an encoder uses to encode raw data.
The strategy used by an encoder when it encounters exceptional floating-point values.
